description: Dive into "Picture-Perfect Moments in Annecy" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Picture-Perfect Moments in Annecy

places.generalDescription: Jardins de l'Europe is a picturesque lakeside park in Annecy, offering stunning views of Lake Annecy and the surrounding mountains. This 19th-century English-style garden provides a peaceful retreat for leisurely strolls, picnics, and relaxation. The park boasts century-old plantations, providing a perfect balance of light and shade that appeals to nature lovers and artists alike.

sources.snippet: Also called as ‚ÄúLes Vieilles Prisons‚Äù, or the Old Prisons, Palais de I‚ÄôIsle is located in the heart of the Thiou River and is now an art and history museum. It used to be a prison, a courthouse and an administrative centre, dating back to the 12th century. Take a snap while exploring the beauty of the canal which Annecy is known for, plus it‚Äôs just 100 meters (328.1 feet) away from Annecy Castle.
sources.shortName: 8 Best Things To Do In Annecy, France (Instagrammable Spots To Visit!)

sources.snippet: A different experience in Annecy where you can explore a beautiful garden full of tulip trees, pines trees and giant sequoia trees. The garden is located right by the lake and makes for the perfect place to explore on a warm summer‚Äôs day. Jardins de l‚ÄôEurope was designed by Henri Porreaux in 1863 and has been maintained meticulously ever since.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Things To Do in Annecy

sources.snippet: Annecy also features a beautiful lakeside garden called Jardins de l'Europe. Many locals and tourists come here for leisurely walks and picnics, as the park is open 24 hours a day.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Beautiful Spots in Annecy that are Instagrammable

sources.snippet: Pont des Amours spans the Vass√© canal and connects the Jardins de l‚ÄôEurope with the Jacquet Promenade, a walkway blessed with yet more sumptuous views of the lake and mountains.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Annecy (France)

places.name: Jardins de l'Europe

reviews.text: Breathtaking. Perfect for coming either alone, with friends, or in family. Many activities proposed, clean, and overall calm. The lake is a great activity and the water is overall clean. You can get delicious ice cream, swim, do boat peddaling, bike, play soccer, picnic, or just lay on the grass and chill.

We absolutely loved our trip to Annecy! I highly recommend taking a leisurely stroll along the waterfront and exploring this charming park. The views of Lake Annecy and the surrounding mountains are absolutely stunning, and the gardens themselves are beautifully maintained and wonderfully inviting. It's the perfect spot to relax and soak in the natural beauty of this picturesque French town.

This is a lovely park right between the old town and the lake. It is large with a range of options from shady treed areas to open spaces. There is a kids playground that is fenced off. You are right by the lake with plenty of water sport options available. A nice place to eat lunch, exercise or just relax.

places.generalDescription: The Pont des Amours, also known as the Lover's Bridge, is a romantic footbridge in Annecy that has been crossed by countless lovers. It offers stunning views of the city, canal, and Lake Annecy. Whether you approach it from Paquier or Jardins de l'Europe, taking a walk along the water to reach this bridge is a delightful experience.

sources.snippet: Annecy, France is known for its stunning canal and lake views. One of these is found at the Pont des Amours, a footbridge on beautiful Lake Annecy, at the entrance of the Canal du Vass√©, which is said to be crossed by many lovers in the past, who found refuge and tranquillity. Formerly known as the ‚ÄúGateway to the Public Garden‚Äù, it is believed that if two lovers kiss in the middle of the bridge, they will be united for life.
sources.shortName: 8 Best Things To Do In Annecy, France (Instagrammable Spots To Visit!)

sources.snippet: The bridge faces the boats of the Canal du Vasse and remains sheltered year round from the surrounding trees. Walking along the bridge you have views of the lake and the nearby Swan Island. This metal footbridge connects important parts of the city together like Gardens of Europe to the Paquier Esplanade.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Things To Do in Annecy

sources.snippet: One of the most romantic places to visit is the Pont des Amours. It is a gorgeous bridge that crosses a canal that flows into the Lake‚Ä¶ here is where many couples exchange kisses. It is rumored that if you kiss your partner here, then you‚Äôll be together forever.
sources.shortName: The Fairytale Town of Annecy - Travel blog

sources.snippet: Ce pont nomm√© ainsi √©tait le lieu de rencontre des amoureux. Symbole de la ville d‚ÄôAnnecy, ce lieu est l‚Äôincontournable des touristes et visiteurs d‚ÄôAnnecy. Il est aussi pris√© pour les shootings photos lors de mariages.

sources.snippet: Pont des Amours is an iron bridge famous as a romantic tourist destination for couples. Besides its beautiful views, the bridge is said to bring everlasting relationships to couples who visit.

Things to Do in Annecy

places.name: Pont des Amours

reviews.text: Such a beautiful and romantic spot to stop by when in Annecy!! A must!! The walk in the area is scenic, with towering mountains in the background and the beautiful lake Annecy creating a post card like view üòç you definitely have to come and take in the beauty that Annecy has to offer!

A wonderful spot to admire the lake. The water is so clear and if you go early or is a very peaceful place. It is a very busy spot for locals exercising and tourists. It is very close to the old town so you should have no trouble walking there.
Very beautiful and romantic spot with amazing view to the lake and the surrounding spaces. It is a great place for relaxation from any busy life

places.generalDescription: Le P√¢quier is a picturesque park located along the shores of Lake Annecy, offering breathtaking views of the surrounding mountains. It's a perfect spot for picnics, leisurely strolls, and moments of tranquility. Families with young children will appreciate the playground and spacious areas for various activities. The park also provides benches for relaxation and foot-paddle boats for rent to explore the lake.

sources.snippet: In addition to Jardins de l'Europe, there's Le P√¢quier, which is equally fascinating. This large park, open 24 hours a day, is situated by Lake Annecy and is a popular spot for strolling, picnicking, or simply enjoying the scenery.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Beautiful Spots in Annecy that are Instagrammable

places.name: Le P√¢quier

reviews.text: Really beautiful üòç place
It is a nice park if you want to go for a picnic, but too crowded and all the side of the lake is filled with businesses to rent water bycicles or boats to go on the lake, so it is not that peaceful.

By seeing the wide, large, and peaceful green lawn, your mind will be much better.
Sitting by the lake, enjoy the swan teasing you some french fries.

places.generalDescription: Perched on a rocky peak of the Semnoz massif in southeastern France, Basilique de la Visitation is a striking Catholic basilica with commanding views of the city, Lake Annecy, and the surrounding mountains. Built in the early 20th century, this architectural gem offers visitors an opportunity to hike and enjoy panoramic vistas. Its stunning design and rich history make it a must-visit attraction in Annecy.

sources.snippet: Annecy's most photographed monument, the 12th-century Palais de l'√éle stands on an island in the Canal du Thiou. Tourists will find the best views and photo-ops of the Palais de l'√éle on the Pont sur le Thiou (bridge). From this vantage point, the palace appears fortress-like with its sturdy quadrangular construction resembling the bow of a ship.
sources.shortName: Things to Do in Annecy

places.name: Basilique de la Visitation

reviews.text: Very cool modern church with super cool columns :) the staff in the shop next door were very friendly and had cute candles
Very nice church with beautiful modern stained glass windows. The staff was wonderful and they had a nice collection of candles. The view from the hill is very beautiful as well.

This church is absolutely stunning! Are you curious if it's worth a visit? Totally! I mean, what else can you do in Annecy? Plus, the breeze adds an extra thrill! It's a bit of a climb, but think of it as a fantastic workout after savoring a delicious meal downstairs

places.address: 11 Av. de la Visitation, 74000 Annecy, France

places.generalDescription: Located near the Canal du Thiou, √âglise Notre Dame de Liesse was completed in 1851 and is dedicated to the Virgin Mary. It has become a sanctuary where the counts of Geneva buried their families. The church features a 16th-century clock tower and Gothic stained glass windows from the 15th century, adding to its beauty and historical significance.

sources.snippet: Annecy's most photographed monument, the 12th-century Palais de l'√éle stands on an island in the Canal du Thiou. Tourists will find the best views and photo-ops of the Palais de l'√éle on the Pont sur le Thiou (bridge). From this vantage point, the palace appears fortress-like with its sturdy quadrangular construction resembling the bow of a ship.
sources.shortName: Things to Do in Annecy

sources.snippet: Built from 1846-1851 in the neoclassical style is theNotre-Dame de Liesse Church. This church was built on the 13th century Marist Sanctuary site that was destroyed during the French Revolution. However, some of the original Sanctuary can be found, such as the clock tower, arch windows, and an old wall.
sources.shortName: The Fairytale Town of Annecy - Travel blog

places.name: √âglise Notre Dame de Liesse

reviews.text: Simply an amazing church in the heart of Annecy , the Architecture is simply mind blowing with its massive arches throughout the church and side alcoves . It is a special place , the alter in huge , the statues and art on the walls fantastic . As always there are simple wood pews that add to the serenity of this special place . Definitely well worth a visit when your in town .

Founded in the 14th century by the Counts of Geneva, the church was constructed on the site of an ancient oratory and a medieval square, near a medieval hospice, underscoring the area's long-standing religious significance. It served as a necropolis for the comital family. During the French Revolution in 1793, the church suffered significant damage, with its choir destroyed and the building repurposed. Restoration efforts between 1846 and 1851 led to the reconstruction of the church, preserving elements like the 16th-century bell tower and a Gothic window on the south wall .

Amazing place to see.  The crypt is a whole other church.  Quite the walk up if you dare it.  Very decorated which surprised given its younger than expected.  Great views from there as well. There is a nice winding path you can take coming down.  You are also very close to the Roman theatre and museum

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of the Thiou Canal, Palais de l'√éle is a captivating medieval castle and former prison that has been transformed into an art and history museum. This 12th-century landmark has served various purposes over the centuries, including as a courthouse, mint, and residence for the Dukes of Savoy. Today, it stands as a picturesque symbol of Annecy's rich history and architectural heritage.

sources.snippet: Also called as ‚ÄúLes Vieilles Prisons‚Äù, or the Old Prisons, Palais de I‚ÄôIsle is located in the heart of the Thiou River and is now an art and history museum. It used to be a prison, a courthouse and an administrative centre, dating back to the 12th century. Take a snap while exploring the beauty of the canal which Annecy is known for, plus it‚Äôs just 100 meters (328.1 feet) away from Annecy Castle.
sources.shortName: 8 Best Things To Do In Annecy, France (Instagrammable Spots To Visit!)

Ce lieu charg√© d‚Äôhistoire datant du Moyen √Çge est une maison forte m√©di√©vale se situant sur une petite √Æle rocheuse au milieu du canal traversant la vieille ville. C‚Äôest depuis le pont Perri√®re que la vue de cette maison forte est la plus agr√©able.

sources.snippet: Built in the middle of the Thiou River, is this iconic structure, built around the 12th century, was once used as a prison. Today, the building is a great postcard image for Annecy!. You can look inside for a small fee (3.80 euros).
sources.shortName: The Fairytale Town of Annecy - Travel blog

sources.snippet: Dating back to the medieval era, this building is also known as the "Little Church" due to its unique architecture. You can visit this museum from Wednesday to Monday, 10:00-12:00 and 14:00-17:00.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Beautiful Spots in Annecy that are Instagrammable

sources.snippet: En continuant sur le long des rives du lac, on arrive au niveau du Palais de l‚ÄôIsle une ancienne maison forte datant du 12√®me si√®cle,
sources.shortName: Nos spots pr√©f√©r√©s √† Annecy et ses alentours
15 Best Things to Do in Annecy (France)

places.name: Palais de I'√éle

reviews.text:
I really enjoyed the visit, and the English pamphlet was helpful. Would be nice if there was an audio-tour option. If you can only visit this or the castle, this was more interesting.
It would be nice to see more artifacts in the place, maybe an old blanket and slop bucket in one of the cells?
You can get a ticket that also includes the castle.
Note they both close between noon and 2 pm.

Early September and got good weather.  A bit chilly in the morning but got better later. Don't expect to see much more than what the pictures show. Very picturesque but keep in mind this was an old jail so keep in mind what you are looking at.

The Palais de l'√éle is a stunning piece of medieval architecture and an iconic landmark nestled in the heart of Annecy's old town. Set dramatically in the middle of the canal, it's incredibly picturesque-perfect for photos, especially from the nearby bridges. Walking by it feels like stepping into a storybook.

The museum inside offers a good glimpse into Annecy's history, including the building's use as a prison and administrative center. The rooms are small but atmospheric, with just enough information to keep it interesting without being overwhelming. Exhibits include historical artifacts and some temporary displays that are a nice surprise.

That said, it's a relatively quick visit-about 30 to 45 minutes tops-so manage expectations if you're looking for a full-scale museum experience. Some areas could use more detailed explanations or interactive features. Still, the value is fair for the entry price, and it's worth a stop, especially if you enjoy architecture or local history.

Tip: try to go early in the day or during off-hours to avoid the crowds, and combine your visit with a stroll around the charming old town.

places.generalDescription: Canal du Vass√©, historically dug to supply water for the moat around the Medieval town, is now a picturesque inlet near Lake Annecy. The canal is lined with trees and row boats are often docked there. Visitors can enjoy a leisurely walk along the water, taking in views of the lake and surrounding mountains from nearby bridges. The area offers a peaceful atmosphere with plenty of ducks, ducklings, and swans adding to its charm.

sources.snippet: Cette passerelle se situe au bord du lac d‚ÄôAnnecy, √† l‚Äôentr√©e du Canal du Vass√©_ (dont je vous parlerai un peu plus loin). Il permet de relier le P√¢quier_ (appel√© aussi _Champ de Mars_ est une vaste esplanade paysag√®re de sept hectares et demi o√π les gens pique-niquent, s‚Äôallongent et jouent) aux _jardins de l‚ÄôEurope_ (un vaste parc d√©di√© √† la promenade se situant sur les rives du lac).
sources.shortName: Nos spots pr√©f√©r√©s √† Annecy et ses alentours

sources.snippet: Bird and view of the Thiou canal, √éle palace (former prison) home to the Annecy History museum, small bridge, √éle quay (flower-bedecked bank), houses with colourful facades and mountain in background
sources.shortName: Annecy - 43 quality high-definition images

places.name: Canal du Vass√©

reviews.text: Canal du Vass√© is a beautiful and peaceful spot in Annecy, lined with majestic plane trees and offering a scenic walk along the water. The calm, reflective waters make it an ideal place to relax, take photos, or enjoy a quiet moment away from the busier areas of the city. It's especially picturesque in the early morning or at sunset, with the boats gently moored along the canal. A lovely place to experience the natural charm of Annecy.

Lovely. We never tire of how picturesque this part of Annecy is, how clear and clean the water is.

Probably one of the most photographed locations in this pretty city.

Level 9 Google reviewer; 1,000 plus reviews, 1.5 million views and over 12,000 photos with over 50 million views and still going strong üí™.

Check out my other reviews üåü üåü üåü üåü üåü.
Beautiful walk along the water filled with little boats and covered by beautiful trees, worth a visit and stroll for sure!

places.generalDescription: Located by the waterside, √âglise Saint-Fran√ßois de Sales is a Catholic church known for its simple white facade and understated interior. It is situated in the charming area of Les Balmettes, offering visitors a serene place for reflection. The church stands out as a peaceful retreat amidst the bustling attractions of Annecy, such as Lake Annecy and Ch√¢teau d'Annecy.

sources.snippet: Annecy's most photographed monument, the 12th-century Palais de l'√éle stands on an island in the Canal du Thiou. Tourists will find the best views and photo-ops of the Palais de l'√éle on the Pont sur le Thiou (bridge). From this vantage point, the palace appears fortress-like with its sturdy quadrangular construction resembling the bow of a ship.
sources.shortName: Things to Do in Annecy

sources.snippet: In the 1530s, the bishop of Geneva was evicted due to his beliefs in Calvinism and took refuge in Annecy. This made Annecy a strategic center of the country‚Äôs Reformation, especially with St. Francois de Sales, resulting in the erection of the church. The location is here.
sources.shortName: The Fairytale Town of Annecy - Travel blog
Annecy - 43 quality high-definition images

places.name: √âglise Saint-Fran√ßois de Sales

reviews.text: Nice church to visit overlooking the Le Thiou canal. The area was very beautiful and clean and worth the visit.

Located near the Lake Annecy and in the centre of town.

The church is big and beautiful. The church has many beautiful intricately designed religious artefacts.

It seems to me that within the church lie the remains of Saint Francois and Saint Jeanne de Chantal cause i saw what looked like their tombs.

The walls are white and they brighten up the church.  The chairs or benches look like ther are of a different era

The church is a good place to visit if you are around the area.  The church certainly needs a lot of maintenance to save the beautiful artefacts. The altar is stunning.
The church is located next to the canal flowing into the lake Annecy. Beautiful church understated on the outside but full on inside, great position.

places.address: 1 Pl. Saint-Fran√ßois de Sales, 74000 Annecy, France

places.generalDescription: Perched on a hill overlooking the old town, Mus√©e-Ch√¢teau d'Annecy is a restored medieval castle that has been transformed into a museum. Constructed over four centuries from the 12th to 16th centuries, it was once the residence of the Counts of Geneva and Dukes of Genevois-Nemours. The castle now houses regional sculptures, paintings, and contemporary art, offering visitors a captivating journey through time.

sources.snippet: Visit the Annecy Castle where Counts of Geneva and the Dukes of Genevois-Nemours once resided during the 13th and 14th centuries. The structure today is a result of a combination of medieval defensive architecture and renaissance elegance. After the residence was abandoned in the 17th century, the castle was used as a military barracks until 1947.
sources.shortName: The Fairytale Town of Annecy - Travel blog

sources.snippet: Ch√¢teau d'Annecy, or Annecy Castle, is a medieval castle perched on a hill, offering breathtaking views of the city and the lake. Today, the castle has been transformed into Le Musee-Chateau d'Annecy. Its operating hours are from Wednesday to Monday, 10:00-12:00 and 14:00-17:00.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Beautiful Spots in Annecy that are Instagrammable

sources.snippet: The seat of the Counts of Geneva, Ch√¢teau d‚ÄôAnnecy dates to between the 12th and 16th centuries, and there are a few good reasons to climb the steep hill up to this building.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Annecy (France)
11 Best Things To Do in Annecy

places.name: Mus√©e-Ch√¢teau d'Annecy

reviews.text: Especially the museum is worth to visit this castle. You get a huge variety of exciting  views into modern arts, history and also geographical and natural development of the whole region. You should not miss this. The entrance fee is very fair for what they offer!

It is a very impressive building, and the refurbishment of it is very impressive. Lots of history and at the moment has an art exhibition, which will please a lot of people, but I am afraid I am still old school. At 6.50 euros, it is great value. WC's are available in a couple of places, so no need to cross your legs. It's  a shame they don't have rides to the top, from the market, but it was very hot, 31 degrees today. 20.06.25. A great visit, thank you üòä

It is worth the effort to walk up the short but steep hill to the chateau for the views alone but it was also worthwhile going inside. Lots of interesting art, both old and new (ish). It's a pretty cheap place to visit and you can go when it suits, no need to book ahead of time. We spent about an hour there which was more than enough. Takes about 10mins to walk there from the base of the hill on old town.

places.generalDescription: Cath√©drale Saint-Pierre, once a chapel for a Franciscan priory, is an ornate cathedral featuring vaulted ceilings and a majestic pipe organ. Located in Annecy, it stands as a historical and architectural gem amidst the charming surroundings of Les Balmettes and Canal Saint-Dominique. The cathedral offers visitors a serene atmosphere to admire its intricate design and rich history.

sources.snippet: This hidden historical church was built in the Renaissance style in the 16th century. It was built for the Franciscans, and it is where Saint Francois de Sales was the first bishop. At the time, the place was shared between two denominations: Calvinists and Catholics.
sources.shortName: The Fairytale Town of Annecy - Travel blog
Things to Do in Annecy
Annecy - 43 quality high-definition images

places.name: Cath√©drale Saint-Pierre

reviews.text: The cathedral of Saint Pierre has architectural marvels. 16th century, oldest church in the city. Has a gothic styles interior with wonderful craftsmanship. Free to enter so worth a visit.

Originally constructed between 1535 and 1538 as a chapel for the Cordeliers convent, the building gained prominence in 1538 when it became the refuge for the Bishop of Geneva during the Protestant Reformation. Elevated to cathedral status in 1822, it has since stood as the seat of the Diocese of Annecy. Notably, during the French Revolution, the cathedral was repurposed as a ‚ÄúTemple of Reason,‚Äù reflecting the era's secular ideologies .
Very beautiful cathedral, and entering it was very serene and blessed.
